source.5d737365:
##### CHECK PRE-TRAINED WEIGHT FILES

import os

source.7e5c9feb:
##### LOAD PRE-TRAINED MODEL

import torch
import torch.nn as nn

model_name = 'efficientnet-b0'
file_name  = '../input/efficientnet-pytorch/efficientnet-b0-08094119.pth'
out_dim    = 1

model = EfficientNet.from_name(model_name)
model.load_state_dict(torch.load(file_name))

model._fc = nn.Linear(model._fc.in_features, out_dim)
source.ca5a7665:
In computer vision code competitions, we frequently need to perform inference in a notebook that does not have internet access. This notebook demonstartes how to use the [EfficientNet dataset](https://www.kaggle.com/kozodoi/efficientnet-pytorch) to install the latest version of the EfficientNet PyTorch package locally and load the pre-trained model weights.

First, we need to specify the packge path to be able to import modules from it.
source.47643c91: Apart from the package with model functions, we have pre-trained weights for models from B0 to B7 in PyTorch format:
source.6fe31bd1: Let's instantiate one of the models and load the pre-trained weights.
